title: FTSE LIVE: HSBC profits drop by a fifth; Brexit in focus as MP vote on election
text:
HSBC is accelerating its transformation plans after the global bank reported an 18 per cent drop in third-quarter profits. Its boss singled out the poorly-performing UK business amid reports of 10,000 job cuts.

Meanwhile, Kostyantin Zhevago, the boss of scandal-hit mining business Ferrexpo has temporarily stepped down to battle criminal claims made against another company he used to own - Finance and Credit.

It's going to be an incredibly busy week in the markets, with central banks, British politics, earnings season and the US jobs report vying for attention.

In the UK today, MPs will vote later on whether to back a December general election while EU ambassadors decide on the length of a Brexit extension.
